job.title: SPG iOS Software Engineer - Platform Foundation / Low Level Software
job.description: <br><strong>Summary<br></strong> <br>As a Software Engineer within Apple’s Special Projects Group (SPG), you will be part of a team creating new and innovative experiences for human interaction with autonomous technology. You will be prototyping and developing frameworks and daemons on Apple internal iOS platforms.<br><br><br>We work in a fast paced, startup-like environment and you will be part of every stage of development working multi-functionally with user interface designers, mechanical, electrical, and controls engineers from concept phase to deployment.<br><br><br>We are looking for an on-device full-stack engineer who is passionate about software quality and user experience.<br><br> <br><strong>Key Qualifications<br></strong> <br>Proficient in Swift and/or Objective-C. <br><br>Familiarity with common iOS frameworks.<br><br>Experience creating powerful and concise APIs and broad knowledge of layered software architecture. <br><br>Strong understanding of algorithms, data structures, object-oriented programming and design with keen eye to best practices and design patterns.<br><br>Experience with performance – profiling, identifying, and implementing optimization strategies. <br><br>Deep understanding of memory management, multi-threaded programming, and synchronization. <br><br>Effective communicator, excellent interpersonal skills, and ability to work well with all levels of engineers and people in other fields. <br><br>3+ years experience with software engineering, design, problem solving, and debugging. <br><br>Motivated self-starter and great teammate who thrives working in a dynamic environment and learning new technologies.<br><br> <br><strong>Description<br></strong> <br>This position requires a proactive engineer with strong technical and interpersonal skills to handle responsibilities including:<br><br><br>- Design, architect and implement new frameworks and daemons, primarily in Swift/Objective-C.<br><br>- Implement features that involve communication over network layers with other hardware components and various cloud back-ends.<br><br>- Understand product requirements, engage with team members and customers to define solutions, and estimate the scope of work required.<br><br>- Deliver solutions that can keep up with a rapidly evolving product.<br><br>- Develop software that works in safety-critical environments, and build test and verification pipelines that ensure reliability and resiliency.<br><br>- Write comprehensive unit tests and work closely with software integration teams for the software you deliver.<br><br>- Shell and Python scripting (e.g. for test tools development).<br><br>- Participate in architecture and code reviews, and hiring interviews.<br><br> <br><strong>Education &amp; Experience<br></strong> <br>BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.<br><br> <br><strong>Additional Requirements<br></strong> <br>While the following skills aren’t required, knowledge of one or more of these areas would be valuable:<br><br><br>- Knowledge &amp; experience with C.<br><br>- Knowledge of networking with TCP/IP, UDP and TLS and investigating problems with WireShark.<br><br>- Experience diagnosing and resolving multithreading and memory corruption issues.<br><br>- Experience with memory performance debugging tools and strategies. <br><br>- Experience working with embedded systems and knowledge of hardware architecture.<br><br>- Experience with writing developer documentation.<br><br> <br>Role Number: 200262405<br><br>
